Thomas Radclyffe (or Ratclyffe) 3rd Earl of Sussex (c. 1525 â€“ June 9, 1585) was Lord-Lieutenant of Ireland during the Tudor period of English history, and a leading courtier during the reign of Elizabeth I. He was born about 1525, and after his father's succession to the earldom in 1542 was styled Viscount Fitzwalter.

ruthless against the irish and scottish

In July 1572 Sussex became Lord Chamberlain, and he was henceforth in frequent attendance on Queen Elizabeth, both in her progresses through the country and at court, until his death.
